UR01NM: (England/Wales) Urban ≥ 10k – sparse: OA falls within urban settlements with a population of 10,000 or more and the wider surrounding area is sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Town and Fringe – sparse: OA falls within the Town and Fringe category and the wider surrounding area is sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Village – sparse: OA falls within the Village category and the wider surrounding area is sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Hamlet and Isolated Dwelling – sparse: OA falls within the Hamlet and Isolated Dwelling category and the wider surrounding area is sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Urban ≥ 10k – less sparse: OA falls within urban settlements with a population of 10,000 or more and the wider surrounding area is less sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Town and Fringe – less sparse: OA falls within the Town and Fringe category and the wider surrounding area is less sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Village – less sparse: OA falls within the Village category and the wider surrounding area is less sparsely populated
(England/Wales) Hamlet and Isolated Dwelling – less sparse: OA falls within the Hamlet and Isolated Dwelling category and the wider surrounding area is less sparsely populated
(Scotland) Large Urban Area: Settlement of over 125,000 people
(Scotland) Other Urban Area: Settlement of 10,000 to 125,000 people
(Scotland) Accessible Small Town: Settlement of 3,000 to 10,000 people, within 30 minutes drive of a settlement of 10,000 or more
(Scotland) Remote Small Town: Settlement of 3,000 to 10,000 people, with a drive time of 30 to 60 minutes to a settlement of 10,000 or more
(Scotland) Very Remote Small Town: Settlement of 3,000 to 10,000 people, with a drive time of over 60 minutes to a settlement of 10,000 or more
(Scotland) Accessible Rural: Settlement of less than 3,000 people, within 30 minutes drive of a settlement of 10,000 or more
(Scotland) Remote Rural: Settlement of less than 3,000 people, with a drive time of 30 to 60 minutes to a settlement of 10,000 or more
(Scotland) Very Remote Rural: Settlement of less than 3,000 people, with a drive time of over 60 minutes to a settlement of 10,000 or more
(NI) Belfast Metropolitan Urban Area
(NI) Derry Urban Area
(NI) Large Town: 18,000 and under 75,000 people
(NI) Medium Town: 10,000 and under 18,000 people
(NI) Small Town: 4,500 and under 10,000 people
(NI) Intermediate Settlement: 2,250 and under 4,500 people
(NI) Village: 1,000 and under 2,250 people
(NI) Small Village, Hamlet or Open Countryside: less than 1,000 people
